results.title: A Mountain's domain
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Motion Picture Associates, Peter Johnson and Robert Walker
results.brief_description: The mountain is Mount Warning in the north-eastern part of New South Wales. Its domain is the warm, colorful scenery of the Tweed and Byron Rivers and Gold Coast region. This tourist film is packed with landscape, but it also dwells upon the people of the north-east who are as important to the region as its climate and natural beauty.

results.title: A Most attractive man
results.creator_credit: A Most Attractive Man Productions, Australian Film Commission, Gillian Coote and Rivka Hartman
results.brief_description: Dorian gets by on his looks, and lives off Frances, a single mother of three kids. He doesn’t contribute much to either her emotional or financial well being. Frances is running out of patience and Dorian’s looks are fading. Described as a “sardonic Australian love story” and made on a $50,000 budget this quirky short film won the Australian Film Institute Jury Award in 1982. Cast includes Carole Skinner, Grigor Taylor, Julie McGregor, Dennis Miller, Anna Volska, Cathy Downes, Anne Tenney, Rivka Hartman.

results.title: A Mongolian tale
results.creator_credit: China Film Co, Ma Fung Kwok, Wellington Fung and Xie Fei
results.brief_description: This film attractively depicts the harsh life of the Mongolian Steppes, it is a deeply moving film. An old woman lives a lonely traditional life on the beautiful Mongolian Steppes. She and her orphaned granddaughter eke out a living as shepherds. When a fathers asks to leave his little boy with them to be brought up, the old lady acepts gracefully. The children grow up a brither and sister, learning to survive the blistering summers and freezing winters. They cant afford a horse, but as fate would have it, a lost foal wanders into their compound one cold night and becomes the boys proudest possession. The children grow up and become engaged, the young man leaves for the city and an education. Upon his return, his sweetheart has become pregnant to the local bully In Chinese with English subtitles.

results.title: A Moment of innocence = Bread and flower = Nun va goldoon
results.brief_description: When film director Mohsen Makhmalbaf was seventeen, as a member of an anti-Shah militant group, he was arrested for knifing a policeman and ended up in the notorious torture chamber administered by the Shah’s hated SAVAK secret police. Twenty years later the policeman he wounded ended up auditioning for a role in one of his films. From that bizarre coincidence Makhmalbaf developed a script in which both the policeman and the activist have a chance to tell each side of their story on film. However, “A Moment of Innocence” is much more than a study in political perspective. As the two older men recruit young actors to play themselves on film, they must deal with both cinema’s ability to romanticise and falsify history, as well as having to explain to a younger generation the complicated history of Iran prior to the 1979 revolution. As the young actors struggle to understand the hatreds of the past, they also force the older men to understand their own mistakes and their own prejudices. This remarkable film, beautifully shot in the middle of a Teheran winter, is a celebration of the humanist impulse in history and also a remarkably optimistic celebration of young people which puts much of Hollywood’s cynical exploitation of youth to shame. In Farsi with English subtitles. Also distributed under the title “A Matter of Innocence”.

results.title: A Moment in love
results.brief_description: A ballet choreographed by Anna Sokolow and designed for camera by Shirley Clarke, featuring movements and images physically impossible to perform on stage. Depicts the passion between two lovers who meet in the clouds and move through a world of fantasy. The dancers are Carmela Gutierrez and Paul Sanasardo. Music, Norman Lloyd. Cinematography, Bert and Shirley Clarke. A film without commentary.

results.title: A Moment's silence
results.brief_description:
“A Moment’s Silence” is a short film which explores the rhythm of the city of Amsterdam, but in a way that side-steps the familiar representation of a metropolis as a place where speed, power and progress converge.

Van Der Keuken’s camera shows us a major intersection drawing to a halt; cars and pedestrians wait in eerie silence in respect of some civic memorial. The soundtrack is bare of narration; not knowing the details, we can only observe the form.

From this quiet moment we move into the back streets and canals to witness a series of everyday events portrayed in a halting stop-start rhythm, where simple observation is combined with the use of repetition and jump cut editing.

Children play on rubbish skips, workmen clear a building site, and a man builds a fire out of junk with the canal lapping at his feet. These small events on the edges of the city’s life are brought momentarily to centre stage in this brief, poetic film.
